context.description: Comprehensive security vulnerability assessment scripts for Windows/Linux/Cloud/DB/WAS

rules: NEVER access, read, or output contents of .env files, secrets/ directory, or any files containing credentials, API keys, or certificates
NEVER execute destructive commands: rm -rf, registry modifications, firewall rule changes, or any commands that could damage system integrity
ALWAYS require explicit user approval before running any command that modifies files, creates commits, or changes system state
When creating Pull Requests, ALWAYS include: reason for change, security impact assessment, and test results
For security audit scripts (Oracle, Tibero, DB2, Tomcat, etc.), focus on read-only operations and evidence collection
All database audit scripts must use read-only connections when possible
Output files should be timestamped and marked with appropriate permissions (600 or 400)
Follow KISA 2021 baseline, Cloud Vulnerability Guide 2024, and TLP Network Guide 2024 standards
